2023-06-22.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2023-06-22.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is in Pines Music Park on the southwest edge of town and includes camping. Headliners include Pert Near Sandstone, the Avett Brothers and Charley Crockett.

2023-06-22.name: Swedish Days Festival
2023-06-22.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2023-06-22.name: Summerfest
2023-06-22.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-06-22.name: Country Fest
2023-06-22.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features the Zac Brown Band, Jon Pardi and Don + Shay.

2023-06-22.name: Lakes Jam
2023-06-22.summary: Hardy, Dustin Lynch and Skillet are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2023-06-22.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-22.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-22.name: Water Ski Days
2023-06-22.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2023-06-23.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2023-06-23.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is in Pines Music Park on the southwest edge of town and includes camping. Headliners include Pert Near Sandstone, the Avett Brothers and Charley Crockett.

2023-06-23.name: Country Fest

2023-06-23.name: Lakes Jam
2023-06-23.summary: Hardy, Dustin Lynch and Skillet are among the headliners at this music-and-camping festival at Brainerd International Raceway.

2023-06-23.name: Musky Fest
2023-06-23.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2023-06-23.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2023-06-23.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2023-06-23.name: Twin Cities Jazz Festival
2023-06-23.summary: Listen to jazz in Mears Park, in St. Paul's Lowertown.

2023-06-23.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2023-06-23.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2023-06-23.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2023-06-23.name: Scandinavian Festival
2023-06-23.summary: This festival in Viking Ship Park includes a Viking battle performance, storytelling, artisan demonstrators and Nordic food that tell about society and culture in Viking-age Scandinavia and beyond.

2023-06-24.name: Blue Ox Music Festival
2023-06-24.summary: This family-friendly acoustic festival is in Pines Music Park on the southwest edge of town and includes camping. Headliners include Pert Near Sandstone, the Avett Brothers and Charley Crockett.

2023-06-24.summary: This year's big outdoor festival near Chippewa Falls features the Zac Brown Band, Jon Pardi and Don + Shay.

2023-06-24.name: Musky Fest
2023-06-24.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2023-06-24.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2023-06-24.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2023-06-24.name: Twin Cities Jazz Festival
2023-06-24.summary: Listen to jazz in Mears Park, in St. Paul's Lowertown.

2023-06-24.name: Spring Iowa Barn Tour
2023-06-24.summary: This self-guided tour of historic barns concentrates on barns in Van Buren County in the southeast corner of Iowa.

2023-06-24.name: Strawberry Festival
2023-06-24.summary: During this popular event in an old mill town north of Milwaukee, there's music, kids' games, a rubber-duck race, shortcake-eating and bubblegum-blowing contests and strawberries in everything  — brats, wine, slush.

2023-06-24.name: Afton Strawberry Festival
2023-06-24.summary: This village on the St. Croix River offers an art fair, music, games, raptor demos and a strawberry shortcake-eating contest.

2023-06-24.name: Big Top Parade & Circus Celebration
2023-06-24.summary: In the downtown square, there will be circus-themed performances, walking tours, music, children's activities and a Big Top parade.

2023-06-24.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-24.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-24.name: Water Ski Days
2023-06-24.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2023-06-24.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2023-06-24.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2023-06-24.name: ChalkFest
2023-06-24.summary: Artists of all ages decorate the 400 Block of downtown.

2023-06-24.name: Scandinavian Festival
2023-06-24.summary: This festival in Viking Ship Park includes a Viking battle performance, storytelling, artisan demonstrators and Nordic food that tell about society and culture in Viking-age Scandinavia and beyond.

2023-06-24.name: International Bridge Walk
2023-06-24.summary: Walk across the St. Mary's River to Canada at 9:30 a.m. or ride a bike there and back between 8:30 and 9:30 a.m. Walkers can take a bus back from Sault Ste. Marie, Ont., for $5 and must bring a passport. Otherwise, the event is free.

2023-06-02.name: Milk Days
2023-06-02.summary: The festival in this small town just south of Lake Geneva, Wis., is the longest running in the state. There are milk-drinking contests, milking demonstrations, cow-chip lotto, bed races and a parade Saturday.

2023-06-02.name: Aquafest
2023-06-02.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, nationally known country bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2023-06-02.name: Buffalo Days
2023-06-02.summary: This festival in the southwest corner of Minnesota features a cow-chip throwing contest, fire-truck ladder rides, duck races, an arts show and a big parade on Saturday.

2023-06-02.name: Fresh Art Spring Tour
2023-06-02.summary: Artists' studios and gardens will be open along the Mississippi and in the bluffs between Maiden Rock and Pepin in western Wisconsin.

2023-06-02.name: Edina Art Fair
2023-06-02.summary: The juried show in this posh southern Minneapolis suburb draws 375 exhibitors and 60,000 people.

2023-06-02.name: Spring Art Tour
2023-06-02.summary: Artists open their studios in Mount Horeb and other towns in the Wisconsin River valley: Mazomanie, Black Earth, Cross Plains, Blue Mounds and Verona.

2023-06-02.name: Street Faire at the Lakes
2023-06-02.summary: This western-Minnesota lake town hosts a juried arts show with music, fair food and a beer garden.

2023-06-02.name: Sun Drop Dayz
2023-06-02.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2023-06-02.name: Great Wisconsin Cheese Festival
2023-06-02.summary: This Fox Cities festival includes cheese-curd eating, cheese-carving and cheesecake contests and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday cheese parade.

2023-06-02.name: 2 Rivers Wine Festival
2023-06-02.summary: The festival in this town on the Fox and Illinois rivers features wine from 25 Illinois vineyards and jazz and blues in Washington Park.

2023-06-02.name: Festa Italia
2023-06-02.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2023-06-02.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2023-06-02.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2023-06-03.name: Milk Days
2023-06-03.summary: The festival in this small town just south of Lake Geneva, Wis., is the longest running in the state. There are milk-drinking contests, milking demonstrations, cow-chip lotto, bed races and a parade Saturday.

2023-06-03.summary: This northwoods town offers music, kids' activities, a car show, flea market, magic show and craft fair, plus samples of the locally made Sun Drops soda.

2023-06-03.name: Outta Sight Kite Flight
2023-06-03.summary: See giant show kites and stunt-flying demonstrations along Lake Michigan in Kennedy Park. There will be kite-making workshops and kite-flying lessons and contests, and the first 100 kids will receive free kites.

2023-06-03.name: Rhubarb Festival
2023-06-03.summary: There’s a Rhubarb Olympics, featuring the Rhubarb Stalk Throw and Green Eggs and Rhubarb, and a Rhubarb Rant Speakers Corner for opinionated folks. The Rhubarb Sisters entertain.

2023-06-03.name: Great Wisconsin Cheese Festival
2023-06-03.summary: This Fox Cities festival includes cheese-curd eating, cheese-carving and cheesecake contests and a 10:30 a.m. Saturday cheese parade.

2023-06-03.name: 2 Rivers Wine Festival
2023-06-03.summary: The festival in this town on the Fox and Illinois rivers features wine from 25 Illinois vineyards and jazz and blues in Washington Park.

2023-06-03.name: Milwaukee Highland Games
2023-06-03.summary: Listen to bagpipe bands, eat Scottish food and watch sheepdogs, Highland dancers and athletes in Croatian Park.

2023-06-03.name: Festa Italia
2023-06-03.summary: The heritage festival at McKee Farms Park in this Madison suburb features such things as folk dancing, a puppet show, a pasta-eating contest and vintage baseball as well as bocce ball.

2023-06-03.name: Gospel Music Fest
2023-06-03.summary: This free music festival is at the Jay Pritzker Pavilion in Millennium  Park and across the city.

2023-06-03.name: Reggae Fest
2023-06-03.summary: The Trempealeau Hotel hosts this easygoing festival on the banks of the Mississippi.

2023-06-03.name: Wisconsin state-parks open house
2023-06-03.summary: On Free Fun Weekend, visit a Wisconsin state park without paying the daily vehicle fee, $8-$13 for residents and $11-$16 for non-residents. Many parks host guided hikes and other events.

2023-06-03.name: Iowa Arts Festival
2023-06-03.summary: This free downtown festival features an art show, a Global Village, a Culinary Row and music and dance. Sunday is Children's Day, with 10 booths of hands-on activities.

2023-06-04.name: Grand Old Day
2023-06-04.summary: After a three-year hiatus, the popular Grand Avenue street festival returns.

2023-06-09.name: Lilac Festival
2023-06-09.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2023-06-09.name: Aquafest
2023-06-09.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, nationally known country bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2023-06-09.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2023-06-09.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2023-06-09.name: Polish Fest
2023-06-09.summary: This big festival on the lakefront features lots of hearty food, a piano contest, storytelling, vodka-tasting, folk arts and polka dancing.

2023-06-09.name: Walleye Weekend
2023-06-09.summary: In addition to a fishing tournament, this free family fest features live music on four stages, a Friday parade and strongman, volleyball and cornhole competitions, plus a Familyland for small children and a Teen Village with a climbing wall and giant obstacle course.

2023-06-09.name: Midsommarfest
2023-06-09.summary: This street festival in the historically Swedish neighborhood of Chicago features Maypole dancing, music, international food, an artisan market and children's activities.

2023-06-09.name: Butterfest
2023-06-09.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2023-06-09.name: Spring Lighthouse Festival
2023-06-09.summary: The Door County Maritime Museum in Sturgeon Bay offers tours of the peninsula's 11 lighthouses by foot, boat, trolley, minibus and airplane. Tickets go on sale to the public in March; some tours sell out quickly.

2023-06-09.name: Windsurfing Regatta & Music Festival
2023-06-09.summary: This breezy town in southwest Minnesota hosts windsurfing races on Lake Okabena and a free music festival. There will also be children's activities, a bike ride and a fun run.

2023-06-09.name: Blues Festival
2023-06-09.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2023-06-10.name: Lilac Festival
2023-06-10.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2023-06-10.name: Marquette Waterfront Festival
2023-06-10.summary: In Yahara Place Park on Lake Monona, there's music on two stages, children's games and craft-beer and wine tents.

2023-06-10.name: Old Town Art Fair
2023-06-10.summary: In the Old Town neighborhood, there will be more than 200 juried fine artists, a garden walk, live music and children's activities.

2023-06-10.name: Three Free Weekend in Michigan
2023-06-10.summary: Enjoy free fishing and off-road vehicle-riding without a permit or license and free admission to Michigan's 103 state parks and recreation areas. Parking at trailheads also will be free.

2023-06-10.name: Butterfest
2023-06-10.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2023-06-10.name: Wine & Food Festival
2023-06-10.summary: Sample local wines and listen to music at this festival on the Leelanau Peninsula.

2023-06-10.name: PorchFest
2023-06-10.summary: During this afternoon music festival, 19 bands perform for 45 minutes each on porches around town. There will be food vendors, too.

2023-06-10.name: Free Entrance Day at Minnesota state parks
2023-06-10.summary: Entrance to all 75 Minnesota state parks and recreation areas is free today.

2023-06-14.name: Steamboat Days
2023-06-14.summary: The main event is the 12:31 p.m. Sunday parade, one of the region's largest. There's also a carnival, craft show, music, power-boat races, a car show and fireworks.

2023-06-14.name: Perham Turtle Fest
2023-06-14.summary: This town in the northwest Minnesota lakes region features turtle races, music, trolley rides, kids' games, a pizza-eating contest, a parade at 6:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday fireworks.

2023-06-14.name: Ice Cream Days
2023-06-14.summary: The festival in this northwest Iowa town, home of Blue Bunny ice cream, includes an art fair, old-fashioned children's games, architectural tours, a polo match, airplane and helicopter stunts and a parade at 9 a.m. Saturday. And the ice cream is free.

2023-06-15.name: Lilac Festival
2023-06-15.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2023-06-15.name: Steamboat Days
2023-06-15.summary: The main event is the 12:31 p.m. Sunday parade, one of the region's largest. There's also a carnival, craft show, music, power-boat races, a car show and fireworks.

2023-06-15.name: Bridgefest
2023-06-15.summary: There will be helicopter rides, a water-ski show, a Friday parade and Saturday fireworks. The two towns are linked by the Keweenaw Peninsula's massive Portage Lift Bridge.

2023-06-15.name: Perham Turtle Fest
2023-06-15.summary: This town in the northwest Minnesota lakes region features turtle races, music, trolley rides, kids' games, a pizza-eating contest, a parade at 6:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday fireworks.

2023-06-15.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-15.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-15.name: Jaycee Water Carnival
2023-06-15.summary: This town just west of Minneapolis, on the Crow River, celebrates with a boat parade, fireworks, human foosball tournament, canoe races, duck races, a car show and parade Sunday.

2023-06-15.name: Ice Cream Days
2023-06-15.summary: The festival in this northwest Iowa town, home of Blue Bunny ice cream, includes an art fair, old-fashioned children's games, architectural tours, a polo match, airplane and helicopter stunts and a parade at 9 a.m. Saturday. And the ice cream is free.

2023-06-15.name: Rose Festival
2023-06-15.summary: This town east of Ames calls itself Iowa's rose capital, and it celebrates with garden tours, children's games, a truck and tractor pull, music, fireworks and a parade at 10 a.m. Saturday.

2023-06-16.name: Lilac Festival
2023-06-16.summary: There are concerts, lilac walking tours, a dog and pony show, a family fun area and, on the last day, a big parade.

2023-06-16.name: Steamboat Days
2023-06-16.summary: The main event is the 12:31 p.m. Sunday parade, one of the region's largest. There's also a carnival, craft show, music, power-boat races, a car show and fireworks.

2023-06-16.name: Bridgefest
2023-06-16.summary: There will be helicopter rides, a water-ski show, a Friday parade and Saturday fireworks. The two towns are linked by the Keweenaw Peninsula's massive Portage Lift Bridge.

2023-06-16.name: Perham Turtle Fest
2023-06-16.summary: This town in the northwest Minnesota lakes region features turtle races, music, trolley rides, kids' games, a pizza-eating contest, a parade at 6:30 p.m. Friday and Saturday fireworks.

2023-06-16.name: More on 34
2023-06-16.summary: A 131-mile yard sale along U.S. 34 from Aurora to Galesburg, with events in many towns.

2023-06-16.name: Great Galena Balloon Race
2023-06-16.summary: Eagle Ridge Resort hosts two balloon races, two night glows and rides for the public. There's also live music, inflatables for kids, a Saturday art fair and a classic car show Saturday night.

2023-06-16.summary: The harbor-side North House Folk School on Lake Superior kicks off summer with a boat parade, dancing, craft demonstrations, mini-courses and a solstice parade.

2023-06-16.summary: This bluegrass festival is off the Door Peninsula, and tickets include tent camping.

2023-06-16.summary: This air show at Downtown Airport also features live music, children's activities, food and fireworks both nights.

2023-06-17.summary: With music, dance, food and family activities, this festival in Bethune Park commemorates the ending of slavery in 1865.

2023-06-18.name: Swedish Day
2023-06-18.summary: This heritage festival in Good Templar Park includes Maypole dancing, Viking reenactors, children's crafts, food and a Swedish market.

2023-06-05.name: Aquafest
2023-06-05.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, nationally known country bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2023-06-06.name: Aquafest
2023-06-06.summary: The festival in this northwest Wisconsin lakes town includes a carnival, art fair, kids' fishing derby, car show, nationally known country bands and, on the last day, a parade followed by a water-ski show.

2023-06-08.name: Mount Horeb Summer Frolic
2023-06-08.summary: Just west of Madison, this town celebrates with a bean-bag toss, dog show, volleyball, craft-beer tent, Saturday fireworks and Sunday parade.

2023-06-08.name: Butterfest
2023-06-08.summary: There's an arts and crafts show, flea market and carnival but also  a milking contest, firemen's water fight and a parade Sunday.

2023-06-08.name: Blues Festival
2023-06-08.summary: This year, the largest of Chicago's free music festivals will be held in venues around town as well as in Millennium Park.

2023-06-21.name: Swedish Days Festival
2023-06-21.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2023-06-21.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-21.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-25.name: Swedish Days Festival
2023-06-25.summary: This Fox River town on the western edge of Chicago offers music and a carnival, car show, chocolate crawl and Swedish cottage walk.

2023-06-25.name: Musky Fest
2023-06-25.summary: There will be a carnival, crafts, watermelon- and ice cream-eating contests and lots of festivities downtown, capped by the 1 p.m. Sunday parade.

2023-06-25.name: Des Moines Arts Festival
2023-06-25.summary: This big, juried arts fair at Western Gateway Park downtown includes street theater, live music and a film festival.

2023-06-25.name: Spring Iowa Barn Tour
2023-06-25.summary: This self-guided tour of historic barns concentrates on barns in Van Buren County in the southeast corner of Iowa.

2023-06-25.name: Strawberry Festival
2023-06-25.summary: During this popular event in an old mill town north of Milwaukee, there's music, kids' games, a rubber-duck race, shortcake-eating and bubblegum-blowing contests and strawberries in everything  — brats, wine, slush.

2023-06-25.name: Afton Strawberry Festival
2023-06-25.summary: This village on the St. Croix River offers an art fair, music, games, raptor demos and a strawberry shortcake-eating contest.

2023-06-25.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-25.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-25.name: Water Ski Days
2023-06-25.summary: There's music, an arts and crafts fair and, on Sunday, a parade followed by a water-ski show on Lake Pepin, where water-skiing was invented.

2023-06-25.name: Cedar Basin Jazz Festival
2023-06-25.summary: There will be 42 hours of free entertainment in Sturgis Park, including a Sunday morning gospel set and a jazz brunch.

2023-06-25.name: ChalkFest
2023-06-25.summary: Artists of all ages decorate the 400 Block of downtown.

2023-06-29.name: Summerfest
2023-06-29.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-06-29.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-29.summary:

2023-06-30.name: Summerfest
2023-06-30.summary: They call this the world's largest music festival. More than 800 acts perform on 12 stages along Lake Michigan.

2023-06-30.name: Soo Locks Engineers Day
2023-06-30.summary: It's the biggest day of the year for boat nerds at the Soo Locks. There's a Coast Guard open house, and Portage Avenue will be closed to vehicle traffic, for an arts, crafts and family fun fair.

2023-06-30.name: Petunia Festival
2023-06-30.summary: This festival in the Hometown of Ronald Reagan features music, a carnival, fireworks and a parade.

2023-06-30.name: Riverfront Rendezvous
2023-06-30.summary: There will be lumberjack and magic shows, bands, kids' games, a lighted boat parade and fireworks.

2023-06-30.name: Grant Park Music Festival
2023-06-30.summary:
Professional musicians, many of them world-famous, offer free concerts nearly every evening in Millennium Park's beautiful Pritzker Pavilion. 
This year's schedule includes favorites by Beethoven, Gershwin and Tchaikovsky as well as choral, circus and Broadway evenings.

2023-06-30.name: Riverfest
2023-06-30.summary: This riverfront festival includes music, magicians, dance, a water-ski show and fireworks by the La Crosse Skyrockers.

2023-06-30.name: Catfish River Music Festival
2023-06-30.summary: More than 20 bands perform in Rotary Park during this free festival, which includes artisans, food, beer, wine and fireworks.

2023-06-30.name: Iowa City Jazz Festival
2023-06-30.summary: This downtown festival features a Culinary Row, Fun Zone for kids and  fireworks in addition to music.

2023-06-30.name: Oneida Pow-Wow
2023-06-30.summary: This free family festival near Green Bay features dancing, singing, drumming, indigenous foods and crafts and lacrosse exhibitions.
